## My meme
Write one sentence that introduces your meme and provides some context for its creation (e.g. what the motivation was and how your meme is new/original)

use markdown to include your meme i.e. use !["My Meme"](my_meme.png)

copy the code chunk below to include the code you used to create your meme (you do not need to add your code to it, this will be done automatically when the Rmd is knitted)



```{r file='meme.R', eval=FALSE}
library(magick)
library(tidyverse)

# Building the head text

top_text <- image_blank(width = 825, 
                        height = 125, 
                        color = "#000000") %>%
  image_annotate(text = "You are not Ugly",
                 color = "#FFFFFF",
                 size = 80,
                 font = "Impact",
                 gravity = "center")

# Building the center image

young_Tom <- image_read("https://qph.cf2.quoracdn.net/main-qimg-6b412fa3348ad055237be35bbdade1cc-lq") %>%
  image_scale(330)

Old_Tom <- image_read("https://cdn.fansshare.com/pictures/tomcruise/best-actor-tom-cruise-face-photo-871606198.jpg") %>%
  image_scale(495)
middle_vector <- c(young_Tom,Old_Tom)

middle_row <- image_append(middle_vector)

# Building the bottom text

lower_text <- image_blank(width = 825, 
                       height = 125, 
                       color = "#000000") %>%
  image_annotate(text = "You are just Poor",
                 color = "#FFFFFF",
                 size = 80,
                 font = "Impact",
                 gravity = "center")

# putting everything togheter

meme <-c(top_text, middle_row, lower_text) %>%
  image_append(stack = TRUE) %>%
  image_scale(825)

# Saving the meme as .png

image_write(meme, "my_meme.png")

```

## My animated GIF

Write one sentence that introduces your animated GIF and provides some context for its creation (e.g. what the motivation was and how your meme is new/original)

use markdown to include your animated GIF i.e. use !["My Animated GIF"](Happy_Birthday.gif)


```{r file='gif.R', eval=FALSE}

library(magick)
library(tidyverse)


# creating a vector for the counts
counts <- 1 : 4 %>% as.character()

circle_image <- image_read("C:\Users\64274\Documents\UoA\2023\Sem 1\STATS 220\Project\P1.jpg") %>%
  image_scale(500)

# creating each frame, where the text comes from the counts vector
frame1 <- circle_image %>%
  image_annotate(text = counts[1], size = 100, gravity = "center") %>%
  image_scale(200) %>%
  image_extent("500x500")

frame2 <- circle_image %>%
  image_annotate(text = counts[2], size = 100, gravity = "center") %>%
  image_scale(300) %>%
  image_extent("500x500")

frame3 <- circle_image %>%
  image_annotate(text = counts[3], size = 100, gravity = "center") %>%
  image_scale(400) %>%
  image_extent("500x500")

frame4 <- circle_image %>%
  image_annotate(text = counts[4], size = 100, gravity = "center") %>%
  image_scale(500)

frame5 <- circle_image %>%
  image_annotate(text = counts[1], size = 100, gravity = "center") %>%
  image_scale(200) %>%
  image_extent("500x500")

frame6 <- circle_image %>%
  image_annotate(text = counts[2], size = 100, gravity = "center") %>%
  image_scale(300) %>%
  image_extent("500x500")

frame7 <- circle_image %>%
  image_annotate(text = counts[3], size = 100, gravity = "center") %>%
  image_scale(400) %>%
  image_extent("500x500")

frame8 <- circle_image %>%
  image_annotate(text = counts[4], size = 100, gravity = "center") %>%
  image_scale(500)

# putting the frames in order using a vector
frames <- c(frame1, frame2, frame3, frame4,frame5,frame6,frame7,frame8)%>%

image_animate(frames, fps = 1) %>%

  image_write(animation, "my_animation.gif")

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
